Navigation
Name Rascal/Libraries/Prelude/List/take
Synopsis Get number of elements from the head of a list.
Function list[&T] take(int n, list[&T] lst)
Usage import List;
Description Get n elements (or size(lst) elements if size(lst) < n) from the head of the list. See drop to remove elements from the head of a list.
Examples 
rascal>import List;
ok
rascal>take(2, [3, 1, 4, 5]);
list[int]: [3,1]
rascal>take(6, [3, 1, 4, 5]);
list[int]: [3,1,4,5]
rascal>take(2, ["zebra", "elephant", "snake", "owl"]);
list[str]: ["zebra","elephant"]

Question [2].
The type of take(1, [true, false, false, false]) is

Question [3]. 
take(0, [10, -4, -18, -3]) ==
